displaydate: 1876 (stone); late 19th to first half of 20th century (rubbing)
medium: Hanging scroll; ink rubbing on paper
markings:
“Shan bu zai gao” 山不在高, rounded-oblong intaglio (right, upper)
. . .
inscribed:
Title: 莫愁小像 Portrait of Mochou

Left:
Zhu Borong 朱柏容 (act. late 18th century)
石城西畔楚江東，六代繁華過眼中。剩得英雄兒女事，湖光山色兩空漾。星移物换勝棋樓，無復當時舊冕旒。大抵名王輸一着，閒情都付古今愁。莫愁人去有餘芳，白水青蓮引興長，色即是空空即色，華嚴常住鬱金堂。玳梁重整燕巢新，回首烟波感昔人，此日春風留面目，千秋艷質免沉淪。
曾文正公平定[粵逆]之亂，復整葺金陵勝蹟，故莫愁湖勝棋樓次第落成，廣植花柳，延攬翰墨於此間，暮椿朝飞。新增一番色相。予於乙亥歲渡江南游，適金陵嗣因僑寓此湖，每見名公卿士以及墨客騷人，游覽興懷，琳琅滿壁，真令人有曾經溣海難為水之慨。惟舊有石刻莫愁小像闕[后]未補抑憾事也。愛以昔臨古本重經摹勒上石，更題四絕以志一時之遇而為鴻雪之缘耳。維光緒二年[1876]歲在丙子龍首閏月上澣，淮北朱柏容，海峰氏並跋於月到風來閣次。
Notes:
1. Zeng Wenzheng gong曾文正公 is Zeng Guofan 曾國藩 (1811-1872).
Rubbing seals:
“Haifeng shuhua” 海峰書畫, sq. intaglio
“Huaibei[][][]” 淮北[][][], sq. relief

Right:
Huang Ju 黄鞠 (1796?-1860), zi: Qiushi 秋士. Dated 1836
[to be transcribed]

Second from right:
Zhu Borong 朱柏容 (act. late 18th century)
Signed: “Haifeng zaibi” 海峰再筆. Dated 1879. [The “Haifeng shuhua” seal connected to Zhu Borong’s inscription at left indicates that “Haifeng” is likely his style or courtesy name.]
 [to be transcribed]
Rubbing seal:
“[][][][]” , sq. relief

makers.displaymaker: Zhu Borong 朱柏容, carver, active late 18th century

texts.textentryhtml:
Standing while holding a flower in her right hand, Lady Mochou wears a shawl with decorated borders over her long dress. Known for her beauty, devotion, and virtue, there are different tales associated with a women named Lu Mochou 盧莫愁, who is said have lived in the 5th or 6th century. One story says she committed suicide to avoid a bad marriage. Another has her longing for the return of her husband from war until she could not wait no longer and turned into a lake in hopes of flowing out to meet him. It is not until the 14th century that the Lady becomes closely identified with Lake Mochou (named after her) in present-day Nanjing, Jiangsu province.


In the late Qing dynasty, Zhu Boke recut this portrait based on an earlier pictorial stone that was in bad condition. The painter Huang Ju’s 1836 inscription was probably also copied from this earlier model. Zhu Boke added the title and his own inscriptions dating from 1876 and 1879.

bibliography.boilertext: "Recent Acquisitions," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 18, no. 1 (1959): p. 40-42.
bibliography.citation: "Recent Acquisitions," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 18, no. 1 (1959): p. 40-42., p. 42
